Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (such as a playground, garden, or forest) and one in water (such as a pond or lake).

The student can include drawings of different types of living things in each habitat, such as plants (trees, grasses, bushes) and animals (lizards, fish, ants) that they observe firsthand or from media.
The student can show and label at least two plants and two animals in each habitat to highlight the diversity of life.
The student can compare the living things in the two habitats by drawing and labeling differences and similarities they notice.
The student can illustrate patterns of plant and animal diversity, based on their observations, to show that different kinds of living things can be found in different places.
